column5: I would recommend Tall Pines. The new owners Steve and Andrea are a great couple from Iowa. They run a very clean camp. The cost is $460 a week which include boat and cabin , plus tax, 7 or 8 %. It's cheaper if you bring your own boat, $350.00 plus tax. On Wabaskang Lake.

I would recommend Tall Pines. The new owners Steve and Andrea are a great couple from Iowa. They run a very clean camp. The cost is $460 a week which include boat and cabin , plus tax, 7 or 8 %. It's cheaper if you bring your own boat, $350.00 plus tax. On Wabaskang Lake.

Try Mahkwa Lodge on Lac Seul at 801-582-3443. Huge numbers and high quality fish. My client was up in late May 2005 and they boated over 2000 walleye in 8 days. 250 were over 25 inches. The largest were 11# and 10.5#. My group has been going there in the fall for 12 years, we won't go anywhere else in Ontario. FYI

Looking for a spot for three couples to go to in 2006. Would like to find resort that is around $500 per person for 7 days and can catch Walleye and Pike in reasonable numbers. Any help from you experts would be greatly appreciatted. Would like it to be located in Ontario. Thanks, Charlie
I was up at Gold Pines Resort on Lac Seul this summer and you will catch an abundance of walleyes and a few pike. Great service from the owners and reasonable prices.
Check out www.fivelakeslodge they are located on Gullrock Lake out of Red Lake ontario. Jeff
Check out www.vermilionbaylodge.com think they will have what you are looking for. Family run camp great cabins, boats and motors.

[font color=green size=3][b]www.sleepydogcabins.com this is my favorite lake and Tommy would be happy to accomodate you, he has some really nice cabins and works hard to please his guests. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby

I would definitely recommend Golden hook Camp on Gullrock Lake, just out of Red Lake. It fits your price range, very nice modern cabins, and Bill and Maureen are great hosts. The Bonus is that walleye fishing is spectacular and there are nice northerns caught as well.

i would check out www.poplarpoint.com they are located on gullrock lake and the owners are excellent hosts. they are very reasonably priced at under $300/person if you bring your own boat. the lake is very good for walleye and pike obviously.

i would check out www.poplarpoint.com they are located on gullrock lake and the owners are excellent hosts. they are very reasonably priced at under $300/person if you bring your own boat. the lake is very good for walleye and pike obviously.
I would also suggest Poplar Point Resort on Gullrock Lake. Excellent hosts, good sheltered docks, and the best walleye fishing Ontario has to offer.
